page.title: 15FARMING AT HIGHER HONEYBROOK
page.content: {Higher Honeybrook}is approximately 300 years old and is now used mainly for dairy farming. The cows are a well bred stock of 100 fresians, 40 Herefords and two stock bulls. Weather often causes problems for Mr Strobelt the farmer and the cows. Before now the milk tanker has been unable to reach the farm due to deep snow; all the milk was stored in tanks, dustbins-anything they could find. Also in the winter the pipes freeze over and have to be thawed before milking can start. The cows are milked first thing in the morning and in the late afternoon. Land surrounding the farm is approximately 250 acres and let by Mrs Gibson, the owner of High Hall.
